name: Tehran
standardBusinessHours: Typically 8:00 AM - 4:00 PM, Saturday to Wednesday.
businessEtiquette: Punctuality is valued. Handshakes are common (same gender); use titles (Mr., Ms.). Business attire is formal (suits, modest clothing). Persian is the primary language; English is used in business. Respect for Islamic customs and hierarchy is key.
recommendedMeetingTimes: Mid-morning (10:00 AM - 12:00 PM) or early afternoon (1:00 PM - 3:00 PM). Avoid scheduling during Nowruz or Ramadan.
localLifestyle: Dynamic, urban, and historic. Strong focus on trade, oil, and technology. Public transport (metro, buses) is efficient; traffic is heavy.
localCulture: Proud, Persian, and vibrant, with Islamic and ancient influences. Iranians value hospitality, poetry, and family. Communication is polite and indirect.
signatureDish: Ghormeh Sabzi, Chelo Kebab, Fesenjan, Tahdig
businessHub: Iran’s economic hub, strong in trade and technology. Valiasr Street is the key business district.

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: Valiasr Street
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: A commercial hub with corporate offices and event spaces, ideal for meetings and networking.

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: Golestan Palace
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: A cultural landmark, great for cultural visits or client education.

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: Grand Bazaar
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: A vibrant area, suitable for cultural visits or client entertainment.

networkingEvents.description: Events for professionals in trade, oil, and technology to connect.

networkingEvents.name: Industry Events (e.g., Iran Business Summit, Middle East Trade Expo)
networkingEvents.description: Events for commerce and technology, offering networking opportunities.

businessTip: Show respect for Iran’s Persian heritage and Islamic traditions. Appreciating ghormeh sabzi and Tehran’s historic charm will enhance rapport.

name: Tokyo
standardBusinessHours: Typically 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM, Monday to Friday.
majorPublicHolidays: Coming of Age Day (2nd Mon in Jan)
businessEtiquette: Punctuality is critical. Bowing is standard; handshakes are rare. Use titles (san, sama) and exchange business cards (meishi) respectfully. Business attire is formal (suits). Japanese is the primary language; English is used in business. Respect for hierarchy and group harmony is key.
recommendedMeetingTimes: Mid-morning (10:00 AM - 12:00 PM) or early afternoon (1:00 PM - 3:00 PM). Avoid scheduling during Golden Week or New Year.
localLifestyle: Dynamic, futuristic, and disciplined. Strong focus on technology, finance, and tourism. Public transport (trains, metro) is highly efficient; traffic is minimal.
localCulture: Proud, refined, and harmonious, with Shinto, Buddhist, and modern influences. Japanese value politeness, respect, and tradition. Communication is polite and indirect.
signatureDish: Sushi, Ramen, Tempura, Okonomiyaki
businessHub: Japan’s economic hub, strong in technology and finance. Marunouchi is the key business district.

localLifestyle: Dynamic, historic, and cosmopolitan. Strong focus on trade, finance, and tourism. Public transport (metro, buses) is efficient; traffic is heavy.
localCulture: Proud, vibrant, and Mesoamerican, with Aztec, Spanish, and modern influences. Mexicans value hospitality, family, and tradition. Communication is friendly and expressive.
